docs.lead_paragraph: School and city officials in Little Rock, Ark., are providing full insurance for treatment of drug and alcohol abuse to all the district's 26,000 students, a program that the officials say is the first by a public school system. The coverage pays up to 100 percent of the cost of treating students referred by the school district to 10 local psychiatric hospitals and counseling centers, which have agreed to reduce rates for students in the program.

headline.main: Little Rock Schools Insure Drug Treatment
